name: Mullein
climate: Mullein thrives best in temperate climates where it can receive full sun.
It can tolerate a range of climatic conditions, including dry environments.
Mullein is adaptable and can grow in climates that experience cold winters.
The plant prefers climates with dry summers but can also withstand humidity.
sunlight: Mullein requires full sunlight for optimal growth and flower production.
Without enough sunlight, the plant's growth can become stunted, affecting its vitality.
Direct sunlight helps mullein develop its signature large, velvety leaves.
Consistent exposure to at least six hours of sunlight daily is ideal for mullein.
watering: Mullein has low water requirements and is especially drought-tolerant.
The plant should be watered sparingly to prevent root rot, especially in clay soils.
Allow the soil to dry completely before providing the plant more water.
In the absence of rain, watering mullein every two weeks is typically sufficient.
soil: Mullein can grow in poor-quality soils but thrives in well-drained ones.
Sandy or rocky soils with good drainage are perfect for mullein's deep roots.
Avoid overly rich soils as they may encourage excessive foliage rather than flowers.
The ideal soil pH for mullein ranges from neutral to slightly alkaline.
extra_care_tip: Mullein can become invasive in certain areas, so monitor its spread in the garden.
Removing spent flower spikes can promote longer blooming and tidier growth.
Due to its deep taproot, transplanting mullein can be challenging once established.
Applying a light layer of mulch can help retain moisture and suppress weeds.
